docs.snippet: Mr. Tillerson’s push for nuclear talks put him at odds with his boss. He has been replaced as secretary of state just as President Trump prepares to meet Kim Jong-un.

headline.main: Listen to ‘The Daily’: Rex Tillerson’s Firing and North Korea

docs.snippet: Dr. Redfield, a Baltimore AIDS researcher and advocate for medication-assisted therapies to treat addiction, will take over the public health agency.

headline.print_headline: AIDS Researcher, a Longtime Government Adviser, Is Named to Lead the C.D.C.
headline.main: AIDS Researcher Robert R. Redfield Named to Lead the C.D.C.

docs.snippet: Returning to Washington after a week of urging détente across Africa, Mr. Tillerson was fired in a decidedly undiplomatic presidential tweet.

headline.print_headline: From Jokes to Near Tears, Tillerson’s Final Brush With Diplomacy
headline.main: From Jokes to Near Tears, Tillerson’s Final Brush With Diplomacy

docs.snippet: A Democrat and first-time candidate, Conor Lamb comes from a political family and has a military background — a résumé tailor-made for Southwestern Pennsylvania.

headline.print_headline: Perfect Candidate for Western Pennsylvania, but He’s Not a Republican
headline.main: Who Is Conor Lamb, Winner in a Special House Race in Pennsylvania?

docs.snippet: The leaks contributed to coverage critical of Hillary Clinton and the Obama administration. That does not fit neatly into President Trump’s view of Mr. McCabe as a “deep state” adversary.

headline.print_headline: Report Said to Assail Ex-F.B.I. Official on Media Disclosures
headline.main: Andrew McCabe, Ex-Deputy Director of F.B.I., Will Be Faulted for Leaks

docs.snippet: A fight over the privatization of veterans’ health care pitted the Veterans Affairs secretary against more ardent conservatives. For now, the secretary has won.

headline.print_headline: Besieged by Conservative Upstarts, a Moderate at the V.A. Stands His Ground
headline.main: In Battle Over Future of Veterans’ Care, Moderation Wins, for Now

docs.snippet: The lack of any resolution to the relentless reports of coming firings is leaving many of the president’s top advisers in limbo.

headline.print_headline: Housecleaning in the West Wing Stalls, but a Cabinet Shake-Up Looms
headline.main: No Heads Rolled at the White House on Friday. But Anxiety Abounds.

docs.snippet: Conor Lamb’s victory in Pennsylvania, with his vow to oppose Ms. Pelosi, has emboldened other moderate and liberal Democrats to distance themselves from her.

headline.print_headline: Pelosi Is Sure She Will Lead; Her Party Isn’t
headline.main: Nancy Pelosi Wants to Lead. House Democratic Candidates Aren’t So Sure.

docs.snippet: Jimmy Kimmel replied to President Trump’s crack about the Oscar ceremony’s low ratings, adding that he felt “The Shape Of Water” mirrored Trump’s own life.

headline.main: Jimmy Kimmel Responds to Trump’s Oscar Barb

docs.snippet: President Moon Jae-in informed President Trump that South Korea would send a special envoy to the North to help arrange talks with Washington.

headline.print_headline: South Korea Says It Will Send Envoy to the North
headline.main: South Korea Tells U.S. It Will Send Envoy to North Korea
